bug.short_desc: vlc cannot play BluRays with BD-J menus
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: vlc refuses to play blurays with java menus - claims java is not installed
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): installed packages rpm -qa | grep vlc phonon-backend-vlc-0.9.0-1.fc24.x86_64 vlc-core-3.0.0-0.8.fc24.x86_64 vlc-3.0.0-0.8.fc24.x86_64 [root@p900 ~]# rpm -qa | grep bluray libbluray-0.9.3-1.fc24.x86_64 libbluray-bdj-0.9.3-1.fc24.x86_64 [root@p900 ~]# rpm -qa | grep bdplus libbdplus-0.1.2-1.fc24.x86_64 [root@p900 ~]# rpm -qa | grep java java-1.8.0-openjdk-headless-1.8.0.102-1.b14.fc24.x86_64 tzdata-java-2016f-1.fc24.noarch python3-javapackages-4.6.0-14.fc24.noarch java-1.8.0-openjdk-1.8.0.102-1.b14.fc24.x86_64 abrt-java-connector-1.1.0-8.fc24.x86_64 javapackages-tools-4.6.0-14.fc24.noarch
also with updated libbluray same result (can only play without menus) libbluray-utils-0.9.3-2.fc24.x86_64 libbluray-0.9.3-2.fc24.x86_64 libbluray-bdj-0.9.3-2.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. have vlc from rpmfusion installed + libbluray + java + libbluray + libbluray-bdj + libaacs + libbdplus
Have a BluRay Image 2. start vlc --> media --> open media --> disc selection bluray (hope I got the correct translation - my vlc is in german 3.
Actual results: you can only play the bluray without menus
Expected results: play the bluray with menus
Additional info:
there is no problem on openSUSE Leap 42.1 and Windows 10 x64 for more details see
https://bugzilla.rpmfusion.org/show_bug.cgi?id=4270
I see this too. I even tried setting the PATH and JAVA_HOME to use the Oracle JRE first, with the same result.
The problem exists also on fedora 25
@Xavier Can you please verify that you have the right configure option set for libbluray. Please provide a scratch build to verify if that fix this issue. Thx

The problem was not a configure option, but rather libjvm.so search paths not suitable for Fedora. I've added a patch to the below build and tested it ok with a bd-j bluray I eventually put my hands on... http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=16675894

Hi Xavier,
you almost succeeded - I could play my first BD with JAVA menus on fedora 25
but there is a new problem - search media disc causes a crash - I would like to open a new incident, but I do not know to where the dump is written.
To reproduce the problem you do not need a BD image - problem occurs also for DVD
Take care,
Winfrid

Hi Winfrid,
Thanks for testing. I had only tested with xine yesterday, but now I tested on xine, vlc and player, and all 3 are fine with BD-J now, so I'll likely close the bug once I've made a real build. Oh, and btw, the patch I added to this scratch build of libbluray has already been committed upstream.
Could you please try with a different player than vlc to pin-point the issue ? I believe the problem you are seeing now with vlc is different than the BD-J issue at hand (and thus, a new bug should be opened against vlc).
Regards, Xavier

BluRay disks now play with menus for me too.
Thanks for fixing
libbluray-0.9.3-3.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-41ce1a19af
